alert.note: Alert for Panola; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 2:41AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern De Soto and northwestern Sabine Parishes, southeastern Panola and northern Shelby Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 239 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Center to near Shelbyville to 8 miles southwest of Converse. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carthage, Center, Mansfield, Logansport, Tenaha, Joaquin, Shelbyville, Huxley, South Mansfield, Gary City, Keachi, Grand Cane, Longstreet, Stanley, James, Front, Deadwood, Woods and Paxton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near northern Toledo Bend, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
